input_text:
Job Title: Sr. Process Engineer

Location: Farmington, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Jobot, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Innovative Company Looking For a Process Engineer

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Ben Glover

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $105,000 - $125,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Sr. Process Engineer to join our dynamic team in the Manufacturing industry. This role is designed for a seasoned professional with a deep understanding of Pyro-Process and Process Engineering. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing new processes, improving existing processes, and contributing to the overall operational efficiency of the organization. If you are passionate about engineering and have a knack for problem-solving, we would love to hear from you.

Why join us?

Responsibilities:

 Develop, design, and implement new manufacturing processes to improve efficiency and productivity. Conduct process simulation and risk assessments to ensure the effectiveness of the processes. Analyze current processes and identify areas for improvement. Collaborate with the production team to ensure that processes are clearly understood and correctly implemented. Troubleshoot process-related problems and challenges and develop solutions to minimize their impact. Monitor and analyze key metrics to track process efficiency and make necessary adjustments. Work closely with the quality assurance team to ensure compliance with safety and quality standards. Train and mentor junior engineers and other staff on process operations and improvements. Stay updated with the latest technology and best practices in the field of process engineering.

Job Details

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or a related field. Minimum of 10 years of experience in a similar role in the manufacturing industry. In-depth knowledge of Pyro-Process and Process Engineering. Experience with Hydration and Precipitation processes. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and team management skills. Proficient in using computer software and applications related to process engineering. Ability to work in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment. Strong attention to detail and a high level of accuracy. A continuous improvement mindset with a track record of implementing successful process improvements. Willingness to stay updated with the latest technology and best practices in the field. Familiarity with industry safety and quality standards and regulations.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
